thread.title: Jeremy Corbyn fails to appear alongside Labour candidate for mayor during crucial speech
thread.title_full: Jeremy Corbyn fails to appear alongside Labour candidate for mayor during crucial speech | London - ITV News

author: Simon Harris
title: Jeremy Corbyn fails to appear alongside Labour candidate for mayor during crucial speech
text:
Labour leader Jeremy Corbyn failed to appear alongside his party's candidate for London mayor during a crucial speech today.
Labour Party Leader Jeremy Corbyn Credit: PA Corbyn was expected to join Sadiq Khan at the Labour conference in Brighton.
But when Khan addressed party delegates, Corbyn was nowhere to be seen. He was believed to be in his nearby hotel.
Credit: PA Khan's speech was peppered with references to his background.
The Tooting MP recalled growing up on a council estate and childhood visits to Brighton in his father's double decker bus.
My dad was a bus driver and his garage organised day trips for workers and their families.
â€“ Sadiq Khan, Labour Candidate for Mayor Sadiq Khan, Labour London Mayoral Candidate Credit: PA Some commentators suggest the election will be portrayed as 'son of a bus driver versus son of a billionaire' if Zac Goldsmith becomes Tory candidate.
The Conservatives are expected to name their candidate on Friday.
Last updated Wed 30 Sep 2015 Politics London
